conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls show height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, readable floor-vs-wall separation, correct angled view, and clean cutaway. Minor softness/occlusion reduces corner/readability precision.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment footprint and main room zoning match (living/kitchen at top, bedrooms bottom left/right, central hall/bath core). Some interior partition placements and proportions appear simplified, and several openings (doors/windows) are not fully verifiable or appear generalized.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, dining table, beds) with reasonable scale and room assignment; kitchen and bathroom fixtures are represented but simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Model is readable with consistent materials and clean presentation, but low-contrast monochrome rendering and slight haze reduce visibility of doors/windows and fine partitions.

detected_errors.description: Interior partitions/proportions appear partially simplified versus the 2D plan, reducing strict layout fidelity in smaller areas (hall/closets/bath edges).
Door and window locations/sizes are not consistently distinct or fully confirmable against the 2D plan; some openings appear generalized.
Low contrast/soft rendering makes some geometry (openings, thin partitions) harder to inspect precisely.

summary: A clear and valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout match, but with some simplified partitions and less verifiable door/window accuracy due to rendering clarity and generalized openings.
